news_header: The 2024 US presidential election will feature Donald Trump and Kamala Harris, with the election process involving primaries, caucuses, and the Electoral College system.
news_text: The 2024 US presidential election is scheduled for November 5, with former President Donald Trump running against current Vice President Kamala Harris, who became the Democratic nominee after President Biden withdrew his candidacy. The US Constitution sets basic eligibility requirements for presidential candidates, allowing many individuals, including those with criminal records, to run. The election process includes state-level primaries and caucuses to determine party support, followed by national conventions to officially nominate candidates. The election outcome is decided by the Electoral College, requiring a majority of 270 out of 538 electoral votes to win.
